experience.title: Organized and strengthened Yahoo! APAC TW/HK Search Product, Content, and Engineering in 2021 and 2022. Developed Yahoo! Masks Search and Yahoo! Rapid Test Search during the COVID-19 outbreak, leveraging the existing search platform and integrating government open data APIs. Coordinated efforts with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, product, and content analysis.

Led the implementation of a unified semantic-classes CSS framework in Yahoo! Search FE to accelerate A/B testing in 2017. Delivered a pixel-perfect, metric-neutral CSS framework, enhancing flexibility, reliability, and maintainability in Yahoo! Search.
Drove and led the FE development of the Yahoo! Search Front Page (search.yahoo.com) redesign and rollout across 40+ markets in 2022.

Contributed to Yahoo! Search FE platform migrations in 2015, 2017, 2018, and 2020, developed and migrated search features and functionalities across diverse tech stacks and frameworks in various Yahoo! Search products (Yahoo! Web Search, Yahoo! Dictionary Search, Yahoo! Local Search), including PHP 5.6, PHP 7.1, YUI 3, Node.js, React (w/ Redux), and vanilla JavaScript.
FE ownership of Yahoo! Local Search Direct Display and Yahoo! Dictionary Search (雅虎奇摩字典); leading and driving the redesign and remodeling of the Search UX; impacting 10 million pageviews per day.
Recognized with 2020 TechPulse Best Poster Award and 2022 Yahoo! Search Awards.

awards: 2016 Yahoo Taiwan/Japan Joint Hackathon Best Remote Hack & Best Hacker Choice
2018 Yahoo Taiwan Search DD Hack Day Second Place
2019 Best Internship Award as Project Tech Lead
2022 Tech Pulse Talk Acceptance; 2018, 2020, 2022 Tech Pulse Poster Acceptance

description: Developed a synchronous mechanism for auction listings from Yahoo, eBay, and Ruten to Facebook Pages, integrating Facebook Insights API and embed.ly statistics for business reporting.

description: Developed content-based search suggestions using diverse corpora and implemented time-based query recommendation mechanisms for Yahoo! News, Yahoo! Movies, and Yahoo! Answers.
Applied FP-growth association rules to generate candidate queries and designed an alternative search assist through bucket experimentation.

corp.name: Institute of Information Science, Academia Sinica

description: Developed an online image search application using Contrast Context Histogram (CCH) and built a feature-based search engine for Taiwan's historic buildings.
Assisted in the transition of a video streaming platform to the Chinese Television System (CTS), integrating the Kaltura video platform as the editorial backend.
Developed WASIGHT.COM, a social network similar to DAVEART for design academy students, contributing to FE and BE development.
